answers.answer: What are the exact results with reference ranges?Have you had thyroid function tests done?  If so, what are the results, with reference ranges?

My mpv is 7.6 the normal range is 7.8- 11.0. My rdw-sd is 17.8 the normal range is 12.3- 15.4).  Thyroid tested last April 2013 & functioning properly.  I am 43 years old female & doctor ran a thyroid test on 4/3/2014 no results yet.  He sort of dismissed me when I suggest it might be perimenopause because he advised it is normal that my period is now 23 days apart when it was 27/28 days. My gyno. doctor is not concern advise its normal period & would not order hormone test.  She advise that get thyroids & diabetes testing.I really want to feel better.  I am at the end of my rope.
Inflammatory diseases can cause low MPV and high RDW.

question: Just had blood work done the rdw-sd was high and mpv was low.  Is this a problem I should be concerned about.  I am constantly tire, achy joints, chills, night sweats & one side of scalp is cold.
title: Should be concern about high rdw-sd and low mpv in blood work?
